physics_fixture_set_chain_shape: This function defines a "chain" fixture shape. A chain fixture is comprised of a number of points, which are then connected together using edge shapes to join them. The function itself takes the index (ID) of the fixture and can tell the fixture to loop or not. Setting this to true will connect the last point to the first point with an edge, while setting it to false will not. Note that this function on prepares the fixture to accept the points required to make the chain, and these should be added after calling this function using physics_fixture_add_point(), much as you would when building a polygon fixture.
When creating a chain fixture, you must give it at least two points but you are not limited in the number of subsequent points that you can add to make up the finished fixture.
Whether to close the chain (<tt>true</tt>) or not (<tt>false</tt>).

var yy = room_height / 2;
var fix = physics_fixture_create(); physics_fixture_set_chain_shape(fix, false);
